questions.question: We will get there as soon as you ………………..
questions.description: In as..as clauses, a present tense is often used to refer to the future.

questions.question: Tired ……………………… she was, she went on working.
questions.description: After an adjective/adverb, both as and though can be used in a special structure.

questions.question: ……………………… it may seem strange, I don’t enjoy watching movies.
questions.description: As can mean though only when it is used in a special structure after an adjective / adverb.

questions.question: Is there ……………………….. water in the pond?
questions.description: We use any in questions and negatives.

questions.question: I ……………………… the paper to the attorney’s office.
questions.description: Bring is used for movements to the places where the speaker or the hearer is.

questions.question: I cannot help ………………………… what she is going to do.
He ……………………… speak ten languages.
questions.description: Both can and be able to can be used to talk about ability.

questions.question: This machine ………………………… be operated by a child.
questions.description: Be able to is not normally used in passive structures.

questions.question: The exam was ten times ………………………….. than I expected.
questions.description: Before than we use a comparative expression.

questions.question: She looks ………………………….
questions.description: We use adjectives to modify copular verbs.

questions.question: He never lets me ………………………… a sentence.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after let.
